Class Client

java.lang.Object
Client
public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
The Client class is used to communicate with the server in order to get information from the data base
Author:
Sam Maschmann
See Also:
Server, ClientDriver

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      Client()
      This is the main constructor for Client. It creates the DatagramSocket to communicate with the server

  • Method Details

    • checkNameAvailability

      public boolean checkNameAvailability​(java.lang.String userName)
      method that returns true if the username is not taken OR it is a returning player that hasn't played a series today
      Parameters:
      userName - is the user inputted name for the user
      Returns:
      true if the user can play or false if the user cannot

    • checkWord

      public int[] checkWord​(java.lang.String guess, int round)
      method that checks a word to see if it matches the daily word for a given round
      Parameters:
      guess - String containing the word to test against the daily word
      round - int containing the round number to be tested
      Returns:
      an array of ints, with each int corresponding to the status of a letter; 0 means not in the word; 1 means in the word but not correct position; 2 means correct position

    • getWord

      public java.lang.String getWord​(int round)
      This method gets the daily word for a given round
      Parameters:
      round - The round of the daily word that is being requested
      Returns:
      the daily word of the given round

    • validWord

      public boolean validWord​(java.lang.String word)
      Checks whether the given string is a five-letter word
      Parameters:
      word - a string of five letters to be tested
      Returns:
      true if word is a valid word, false otherwise

    • uploadScores

      public void uploadScores​(java.lang.String username, int[] guesses)
      upload scores takes a username and an array of the number of guesses taken per word and uploads them to the database
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      guesses - an in array containing the number of guesses per word

    • getTopFiveLeaderboard

      public java.lang.String[] getTopFiveLeaderboard​(java.lang.String date)
      getTopFiveLeaderboard takes a string that contain a date and returns a string array containing the top 5 scores and users for that date
      Parameters:
      date - the date to find the leaderboard for
      Returns:
      a string array in the format user,score,user,score... where user is the username and score is their score

    • getUserDailyScore

      public java.lang.String getUserDailyScore​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String date)
      getUserScore takes two strings, one for the username and one for the date, and returns the score of that user on that date
      Parameters:
      user - the username of the player
      date - the date of the score to be fetched
      Returns:
      a string containing the score of the user on the given date

    • getUserTotalStats

      public java.lang.String[] getUserTotalStats​(java.lang.String user)
      getUserTotalStats takes a username as a string and checks in the database to return an array containing statistics of that user including total score, total rounds played, and winning streak
      Parameters:
      user - a string containing the name of the player
      Returns:
      null if user is not in database; otherwise: a string array in the form [totalScore,totalRoundsPlayed,winStreak] where totalScore is the user's total collective score, totalRoundsPlayed is how many rounds the user has played, and winStreak is the user's win streak

    • getTopFiveAllTime

      public java.lang.String[] getTopFiveAllTime()
      getTopFiveAllTime returns a string array containing the top five users with their total scores
      Returns:
      a string array in the form [user,score,user,score...] where user is a top five user and score is their total score

    • setName

      public void setName​(java.lang.String x)

    • sendArr

      public void sendArr()

    • setArray

      public void setArray​(int x)

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
